flawed_nl_solution:
The first night he read 20% of his 500-page book so he read 0.2*500 = <<20*0.01*500=100>>100 pages
The book is 500 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 500-100 = <<500-100=4000>>4000 pages
The second night he reads 20% of the 500 pages so he read 0.2*500 = <<20*0.01*500=100>>100 pages
The book is now 4000 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 4000-100 = <<4000-100=3900>>3900 pages
The third night he read 30% of the book so he read 0.3*500 = <<30*0.01*500=150>>150 pages
The book is now 3900 pages and he read 150 pages so he has 3900-150 =<<3900-150=3750>>3750 pages left to read
#### 3750

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 400, not 4000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
